go_data.justification: TNF is considered to be a proinflammatory, cytotoxic cytokine.
TNF is a critical mediator of lymphocyte-dependent autoimmune pathologies such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and the MS animal model, experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE).
TNF-dependent cell adhesion events are important for the control of cell movement within the tissue.
TNF is involved in the control of cell movement within the tissue and the generation of inflammatory lesions.
